revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Kelly Killoren Bensimon | image = | image_size = 200px | alt = | caption = Kelly Killoren Bensimon at the 2010 [[Tribeca Film Festival]] | birth_name = Kelly Jean Killoren | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1968|05|01}} | birth_place = [[Rockford, Illinois]], US | alma_mater = [[Columbia University]] | death_place = | children = Sea Bensimon
Thadeus Bensimon | other_names = Kelly Bensimon | nationality = American | occupation = [[Model (person)|Model]], [[entrepreneur]], author, [[TV personality]], [[real estate broker]] | years_active = 1980–present | known_for = ''[[The Real Housewives of New York City]]'' | height = {{convert|5|ft|10|in|cm|abbr=on}} | spouse = [[Gilles Bensimon]] (1997–2007) | website = {{URL|http://www.kkbloves.com/}} | signature = }} '''Kelly Jean Killoren Bensimon''' (born May 1, 1968){{cite web | url = http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrities/kelly-bensimon | title = Kelly Bensimon Bio | publisher = [[Us Weekly|UsMagazine.com]] | accessdate = May 26, 2013}} is an American author, socialite and former editor of ''Elle Accessories'' and a former model. She appeared as a full-time cast member on the [[Bravo (U.S. TV network)|Bravo]] television series ''[[The Real Housewives of New York City]]'' from seasons 2 to season 4. ==Early life== '''Kelly Jean Killoren'''{{cite web|url=https://gw.geneanet.org/frebault?n=killoren&oc=&p=kelly+jean|title=Kelly Jean Killoren|work=Geneanet.org}} was born in [[Rockford, Illinois]]. She began working as a model while in her teens. ==Education== Kelly graduated from [[Keith Country Day School]], a college prep academy in Rockford, Illinois before attending college. She attended [[Trinity College (Connecticut)|Trinity College, Connecticut]], but left after a year. {{cite news |url= https://www.nytimes.com/2006/05/18/fashion/thursdaystyles/18KELLY.html?pagewanted=all |accessdate= April 14, 2009 |title= Bikinis, Breakups and the Glam Game |work= [[New York Times]] |date= May 18, 2006 |first= Eric |last= Wilson }}She graduated in 1998 from [[Columbia University]]'s School of General Studies with a degree in Literature and Writing. She completed an MBA with a focus on International Marketing at [[Northeastern University]] in 2015. {{cite news |url=http://www.columbia.edu/cu/observer/archive/observer9604.pdf |title=Of All The Reasons To Interrupt An Education |page=11 |publisher=School of General Studies, Columbia University |date=April 1996 |first=W. J. |last=Radziejewski |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070207044946/http://www.columbia.edu/cu/observer/archive/observer9604.pdf |archivedate=February 7, 2007 }} {{cite news |url= https://www.linkedin.com/in/kelly-killoren-bensimon-b837503 |title= Kelly Killoren Bensimon |work= LinkedIn.com |accessdate= 2019-02-04 }} ==Career== Kelly began her modeling career in New York City. She appeared in magazines such as ''[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]'', ''[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]]'', and ''[[Harper's Bazaar]]''. She was once the face of [[Clarins]]. She is the editor at large for ''[[Hamptons Magazine]]'',{{cite web|title=Hampton's Magazine - Contact Us |work=Hamptons Magazine |url=http://www.hamptons-magazine.com/contact_us.html |accessdate=May 2, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090221102252/http://hamptons-magazine.com/contact_us.html |archivedate=February 21, 2009 }} a free weekly with circulation of 40,000 to 50,000 and ''[[Gotham Magazine]]''.{{cite web | title=Gotham Magazine - Contact Us | work=Gotham Magazine | url=http://www.gotham-magazine.com/contact_us.html | accessdate=May 2, 2009 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080613192312/http://www.gotham-magazine.com/contact_us.html |archivedate = June 13, 2008}} Both publications are owned by Niche Media. She became the founding editor of ''Elle Accessories'', but left after two issues. She authored several books including ''In The Spirit of the Hamptons'', ''American Style'', and ''The Bikini Book'' - American Style was edited solely on her Blackberry.{{cite web | title=Kelly Kelly Bensimon - Author, Trendsetter, Model & Editor of Elle Accessories | work=IMG Speakers | url=http://www.imgspeakers.com/speaker/Bio.aspx?SpeakerID=320 | accessdate=May 2, 2009 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090221204006/http://imgspeakers.com/speaker/Bio.aspx?SpeakerID=320 | archive-date=February 21, 2009 | url-status=dead }} Bensimon also wrote a column in ''[[Page Six]] Magazine'' called "The Socializer: Kelly Bensimon".{{cite news |title=The Socializer: Kelly Bensimon |work=The New York Post |url=http://www.nypost.com/pagesixmag/issues/20080803/Socializer+Kelly+Killoren+Bensimon |accessdate=May 2, 2009 |date=August 1, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090401072133/http://www.nypost.com/pagesixmag/issues/20080803/Socializer+Kelly+Killoren+Bensimon |archive-date=April 1, 2009 |url-status=dead }} Kelly Bensimon is also a style columnist for the newspaper ''[[AM New York]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.amny.com/urbanite-1.812039/ask-kelly-submit-your-style-qs-to-kelly-killoren-bensimon-1.3702041 |title=Ask Kelly: Submit your style Qs to Kelly Killoren Bensimon |last=Gordon |first=Julie |work=[[AM New York]] |accessdate=May 7, 2012 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120508135605/http://www.amny.com/urbanite-1.812039/ask-kelly-submit-your-style-qs-to-kelly-killoren-bensimon-1.3702041 |archivedate=May 8, 2012 }} Killoren Bensimon was host of the [[IMG (business)|IMG]] fashion week, and of the IMG swim shows in Miami. She was a spokesperson in 2006 for Wool as part of their Test Marketing Productions (TMP);. {{cite news |url= http://www.wool.com/uploaded/TMP%20Stakeholder%20-%202-%20Dillards%20Final.pdf |title= Test Marketing Productions - Dillards Program |publisher= Test Marketing Productions - Dillards |date= October 2006}} Bensimon hosted and modeled in menswear events with ''GQ'' magazine. She was also an "ambassador" for Spring 2007 Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week[http://mbfashionweek.com/newyork/] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090227112620/http://mbfashionweek.com/newyork/ |date=February 27, 2009 }} in New York City. Killoren Bensimon's first line of jewelry was uniquely made with fishing lures and was sold exclusively at Barney's New York. Her second line of jewelry was sold at Bloomingdale's in fall 2007. Killoren Bensimon joined Bravo's ''The Real Housewives of New York City'' (seasons 2-4) in 2009 as a full cast member. Her most notable moments on the show include a controversial onscreen nervous breakdown while on a cast trip to the island of Saint John in the U.S. Virgin Islands. After regaining relevance from the Bravo show, Killoren Bensimon appeared on the cover and in a six-page pictorial in the March 2010 edition of ''[[Playboy]]'', which was photographed by her ex-husband Gilles Bensimon in August 2009 at Milk Studios in New York City.{{citation needed|date=May 2013}} On June 24, 2010, Killoren Bensimon announced the launch of her fourth jewelry collection, Kelly by Kelly Killoren Bensimon. The collection mixed metals, leather, feathers and crystals and was sold at Intermix stores across the U.S. to support Feeding America.{{cite news |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/stylebeauty/news/real-ny-housewife-kelly-bensimon-debuts-feather-filled-jewelry-line-2010246 |title=Real NY Housewife Kelly Bensimon Debuts Feather-Filled Jewelry Line |work=UsMagazine.com |date=June 24, 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100628000207/http://www.usmagazine.com/stylebeauty/news/real-ny-housewife-kelly-bensimon-debuts-feather-filled-jewelry-line-2010246 |archivedate=June 28, 2010}} For spring 2011, Bensimon's jewelry collection was sold at Wink, W hotels, and Dash.{{citation needed|date=May 2013}} Killoren Bensimon wrote three books for Assouline Publishing: ''In the Spirit of the Hamptons'' (2 volumes), ''American Style'', and ''The Bikini Book''. A portion of the author's proceeds are donated to the Costume Institute of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.{{citation needed|date=May 2013}} Bensimon's fourth book ''I Can Make You Hot'', was published by St. Martin's Press in April 2012. A portion of the author's proceeds were being donated to Generositywater.org.{{citation needed|date=May 2013}} In June 2016, Simon and Schuster published Bensimon's novel ''A Dangerous Age.''{{Cite book | url=http://books.simonandschuster.com/A-Dangerous-Age/Kelly-Killoren-Bensimon/9781501136115 | isbn=9781501136139| title=A Dangerous Age| date=2017-02-28}} In September 2011, Killoren Bensimon was on the cover of ''[[Shape (magazine)|Shape]]'' and was featured in a pictorial based on her exercise routine. She also opened the NASDAQ on September 1, 2011 to promote the cover.{{Cite web|url=http://business.nasdaq.com/discover/market-bell-ceremonies/detail.html#!/!?ceremonyId=2638|title=Nasdaq: Market Bell Ceremonies|last=Nasdaq|website=business.nasdaq.com|access-date=October 11, 2017}} She was featured in a pictorial in the December 2011 issue of ''Avenue'' magazine and was guest editor for the January and February issues. Killoren Bensimon and her girls also appeared on the June 2012 cover of ''New York Family''. Killoren Bensimon's 2013 projects were her fragrance ''In the Spirit of'' and her candle line ''Baiser Rose''; her HSN jewelry line which was launched on May 19, 2016 called Kelly Killoren by Kelly Killoren Bensimon. The collection was is no longer available on HSN.com. Killoren Bensimon appeared on Bravo's ''[[Odd Mom Out]]'' in episodes 9 and 10 of season 2. In June 2016, Killoren released her first novel, ''A Dangerous Age'' with Simon and Schuster. The loosely based novel on her personal life exposes the art and publishing world via four female friends who knew each other since they were young models, and places them in New York City with a lot at stake. In August 2017, Killoren launched the sequel ''The Second Course'', which is a well researched odyssey about the alluring food world, and in September, she appeared on [[WEtv]]'s reality series ''[[Million Dollar Matchmaker]]''. In March 2018, Killoren began to work as an agent for Dolly Lenz Realty in New York.{{cite web|url=http://www.bravotv.com/the-daily-dish/the-real-housewives-of-new-york-city-kelly-killoren-bensimon-real-estate-career-details|title=Kelly Killoren Bensimon Has a Brand-New Career|work=Bravotv.com|date=March 2, 2018}} In August 2019, Killoren joined the Douglas Elliman real estate group. {{cite web|url=https://pagesix.com/2019/08/13/kelly-bensimon-joins-douglas-elliman-real-estate-group/|title=Kelly Bensimon joins Douglas Elliman real estate group|date=2019-08-13}} ==Personal life== Killoren Bensimon was married to fashion photographer [[Gilles Bensimon]] until the couple divorced.{{cite news|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/871486/secrets-lies-cheaters-frauds-a-history-of-real-housewives-relationship-implosions|title=They could be sisters! Youthful Kelly Bensimon and her fashionable mini-me daughter cuddle up for Mother's Day |author=Jade Watkins |date=May 14, 2012}} They have two daughters, Sea Louise, born in 1998, and Thaddeus Ann, born in 2000. Killoren is Catholic.{{cite interview|url=https://stylecaster.com/kelly-killoren-bensimon/|title=Kelly Killoren Bensimon|interviewer=Carol|quote=I am Catholic and so are my girls.|date=June 16, 2009|work=Stylecaster.com}}{{cite tweet|user=kellybensimon|number=871731101240307714|date=June 5, 2017|title=But at the time, I was terrified. I'm Catholic, so I knew that I would go forward with my pregnancy}} On March 5, 2009, Killoren Bensimon was arrested on allegations of domestic violence and assault against her ex-boyfriend. Her ex-boyfriend alleged that she punched him in the face during an argument. Killoren Bensimon entered into a plea agreement with the State of New York on June 8 to clean her record and was required to stay out of trouble for a year and perform two days of community service in order to wipe her record after her arrest.{{cite news|url=https://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/real-housewives-new-york-city-star-kelly-killoren-bensimon-arrested-assault-article-1.368447|title='Real Housewives of New York City' star Kelly Killoren Bensimon arrested for assault|work=NY Daily News|date=March 10, 2009}}{{cite news|url=http://gothamist.com/2009/06/08/community_service_deal_for_kelly_be.php|title=Community Service Deal For Kelly Bensimon|work=Gothamist|date=June 8, 2009|access-date=February 4, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190427235747/http://gothamist.com/2009/06/08/community_service_deal_for_kelly_be.php|archive-date=April 27, 2019|url-status=dead}} In August 2017, long after her divorce, Killoren Bensimon explained in a video that she went back to her previous name Kelly Killoren, dropping her ex-husband's last name.{{cite web|url=http://www.bravotv.com/the-daily-dish/kelly-bensimon-changes-name-to-kelly-killoren-video|title=Bensimon Is Going by a Different Name These Days|work=Bravotv.com|date=August 23, 2017}}
